metadata.description: Split ergativity rules - the most unique and confusing feature of Hindi grammar
sources: Modern Hindi Grammar - Omkar N. Koul

what_is_ergativity.definition_en: In ergative languages, the subject of transitive verbs is marked differently from intransitive subjects
what_is_ergativity.definition_hi: कर्तृकारकी भाषाओं में सकर्मक क्रियाओं का कर्ता अलग तरह से चिह्नित होता है

split_ergativity.definition: Hindi is SPLIT ergative - ergative only in PERFECTIVE aspect
split_ergativity.perfective: Ergative pattern (ने + verb agrees with object)
split_ergativity.trap: Same verb behaves differently based on tense/aspect!

tenses_with_ne: Simple Past (साधारण भूत) - राम ने खाया
Present Perfect (पूर्ण वर्तमान) - राम ने खाया है
Past Perfect (पूर्ण भूत) - राम ने खाया था

examples.intransitive: राम गया (NOT राम ने गया) - 'go' is intransitive
examples.present: राम खाता है (NOT राम ने खाता है)

with_ne.rule: Verb agrees with OBJECT (in gender and number), NOT with subject

analysis.subject: लड़की (feminine)
analysis.agreement: Verb agrees with किताब (object), not लड़की (subject)

example_1.why_wrong: पढ़ा is masculine, but किताब is feminine

analysis.subject: लड़कियों (feminine plural)
analysis.note: Verb agrees with plural feminine object

without_ne.rule: Verb agrees with SUBJECT (in gender and number)

differential_object_marking.definition: Object marked with को depends on animacy and definiteness
hierarchy: Human nouns (usually को): राम को देखा
Animate nouns (often को): कुत्ते को मारा
Definite inanimate (sometimes को): वह किताब को पढ़ा

effect_on_agreement.with_ko: When object has को, verb defaults to masculine singular

example_1.note: सीता is feminine but verb is masculine because of को

error_1.explanation: जाना (to go) is intransitive - no ने

error_3.explanation: खाना is masculine, so verb must be खाया

error_4.explanation: लड़का is masculine, verb must agree

error_5.explanation: Noun must be in oblique form before postposition

experiencer_subjects.description: Some verbs take को on the subject (experiencer)

example.note: Subject मुझको takes को, verb agrees with भूख (feminine)

compound_verbs.description: In compound verbs, agreement is with the main verb's object

some_verbs_no_ne.description: Some transitive verbs don't take ने (exceptions)
some_verbs_no_ne.note: These are treated as intransitive in ergative construction

comparison_with_english.english_pattern: Subject-Verb-Object, verb doesn't change for object gender
comparison_with_english.hindi_imperfective: Similar to English (verb agrees with subject)
comparison_with_english.hindi_perfective: DIFFERENT - verb agrees with object when ने is used

detection_algorithm.step_2: Is the aspect perfective (past tense, completed action)?
detection_algorithm.step_3: If YES to both → expect ने on subject
detection_algorithm.step_4: Check verb agreement with object (not subject)
detection_algorithm.step_5: Check if object has को → verb defaults to masculine singular
